When multiple delimiters are specified, they will be looked for in the source string in the sequence in which they are coded.

trans-unit.source: Using this, you may replace character sequences that occur at the beginning (see LEADING) or end (see TRAILING) of reserved or user-defined words. For example, to change all words of the form "0100-xxxxxx" to "020-xxxxxx", code LEADING ==0100-== BY ==020-==. To simply remove all "0100-" prefixes from words, code LEADING ==0100-== BY ====.
trans-unit.target: 使用此功能，您可以替换出现在保留或用户定义的单词的开头（请参阅 LEADING ）或结尾（请参见 TRAILING ）的字符序列。例如，要将所有形式为“ 0100-xxxxxx”的单词更改为“ 020-xxxxxx”，代码 LEADING ==0100-== BY ==020-== 。要简单地从单词中删除所有“ 0100-”前缀，代码 LEADING ==0100-== BY ==== 。

trans-unit.source: What font and font size will be used for the report when it is printed? trans-unit.source: When a picture-string contains a repeated sequence of symbols — PIC 9999/99/99 — for example, the repetition can be specified using a parenthetic repeat count, as in PIC 9(4)/9(2)/9(2). Using repeat counts is optional and their use (or not) is entirely at the discretion of the programmer. Many programmers use repetition for small sequences (PIC XXX) and repeat counts for larger ones (PIC 9(9).
trans-unit.target: 例如，当 picture-string 包含重复的符号序列（例如 PIC 9999/99/99 )时，可以使用括号重复计数来指定重复，如 PIC 9(4)/9(2)/9(2) 所示。。使用重复计数是可选的，是否使用重复计数完全由程序员决定。许多程序员对小序列（ PIC XXX ）使用重复，对大序列（ PIC 9(9) )使用重复计数。

trans-unit.source: When a Format 1 REPLACE statement with the ALSO keyword is encountered without Replace Mode being currently active, the effect will be as if the ALSO had not been specified. If Replace Mode already was in effect, the effect will be to “push” the current change specification(s) onto the top of a stack and add the specification(s) of the new statement to those that were already in effect.
trans-unit.target: 如果在当前未激活“替换模式”的情况下遇到带有 ALSO 关键字的Format 1 REPLACE 语句，则效果将与未指定 ALSO 相同。如果“替换模式”已经生效，则其作用是将当前的更改规范“推”到堆栈的顶部，并将新语句的规范添加到已经生效的那些规范中。

trans-unit.source: When a Format 1 REPLACE without the ALSO keyword is encountered, any stacked change specification(s), if any, will be discarded and the currently in-effect change specification(s), if any, will be replaced by those of the new statement.
trans-unit.target: 当遇到没有 ALSO 关键字的Format 1 REPLACE 时，任何堆叠的变更说明（如果有）将被丢弃，而当前有效的变更说明（如果有）将被新语句的那些取代。

trans-unit.source: When a GnuCOBOL program is executed from a command-line, the complete command line text will be broken into a series of
trans-unit.target: 当一个GnuCOBOL程序从命令行执行时,完整的命令行文本将被分解成一系列的

trans-unit.source: When a GnuCOBOL program is executed from a command-line, the complete command line text will be broken into a series of "tokens", where each token is identified as being a word separated from the others in the command text by at least one space. For example, if the command line was /usr/local/myprog THIS IS A TEST, there will be five tokens identified by the operating system — "/usr/local/myprog", "THIS", "IS", "A" and "TEST".
trans-unit.target: 当从命令行执行GnuCOBOL程序时，完整的命令行文本将分为一系列“令牌”，其中每个令牌被标识为与命令文本中的其他单词隔开至少一个空格的单词。 。例如，如果命令行为 /usr/local/myprog THIS IS A TEST ，则操作系统将识别出五个令牌-“ / usr / local / myprog”，“ THIS”，“ IS”，“ A”和“测试”。

trans-unit.source: When an input procedure is used, the procedure(s) specified on the INPUT PROCEDURE clause will be invoked as if by a procedural PERFORM statement (see Procedural PERFORM) with no VARYING, TIMES or UNTIL options specified. Records will be loaded into the sort work file — one at a time — within the input procedure using the RELEASE statement (see RELEASE). This, by the way, is how you could sort the contents of relative or indexed files.
trans-unit.target: 当使用输入过程时，将在没有指定 VARYING ， TIMES 或 UNTIL 选项的情况下，由过程 PERFORM 语句（请参见过程性PERFORM）调用 INPUT PROCEDURE 子句中指定的过程。在输入过程中，将使用 RELEASE 语句将记录一次装入一次记录文件中（请参阅RELEASE）。顺便说一下，这就是如何对相对文件或索引文件的内容进行排序。

trans-unit.source: When an input procedure is used, the procedure(s) specified on theINPUT PROCEDURE
trans-unit.target: 当使用输入程序时，在输入程序中指定的 INPUT PROCEDURE

trans-unit.source: When an output procedure is used, the procedure(s) specified on the OUTPUT PROCEDURE clause will be invoked as if by a procedural PERFORM statement (see Procedural PERFORM) with no VARYING, TIMES or UNTIL options specified. Records will be retrieved from the sort work file — one at a time — within the output procedure using the RETURN statement (see RETURN).
trans-unit.target: 当使用输出过程时，将像没有指定 VARYING ， TIMES 或 UNTIL 选项的过程性 PERFORM 语句（请参见过程性PERFORM）那样调用 OUTPUT PROCEDURE 子句中指定的过程。在输出过程中，将使用 RETURN 语句从排序工作文件中一次检索一次记录（请参阅RETURN）。

trans-unit.source: When an output procedure is used, the procedure(s) specified on the OUTPUT PROCEDURE clause will be invoked as if by a procedural PERFORM (see Procedural PERFORM) statement with no VARYING, TIMES or UNTIL options specified. Merged records may be read from the merge work file — one at a time — within the output procedure using the RETURN (see RETURN) statement.
trans-unit.target: 当使用输出过程时，将像没有指定 VARYING ， TIMES 或 UNTIL 选项的过程性 PERFORM （请参见过程性PERFORM）语句那样调用 OUTPUT PROCEDURE 子句中指定的过程。在输出过程中，可以使用 RETURN （请参阅RETURN）语句从合并工作文件中一次读取一个合并的记录。

Merged records may be read from the merge work file — one at a time — within the output procedure using theRETURN(see RETURN) statement.

trans-unit.source: When comparing strings, the comparison is made based upon the program’s collating sequence. When the two string arguments are of unequal length, the shorter is assumed to be padded (on the right) with a sufficient number of spaces as to make the two strings of equal length. String comparisons take place on a corresponding character-by-character basis, left to right, until the TRUE/FALSE value for the relation test can be established. Characters are compared according to their relative position in the program’s COLLATING SEQUENCE (as defined in SPECIAL-NAMES (see SPECIAL-NAMES)),
trans-unit.target: 比较字符串时，将根据程序的整理顺序进行比较。当两个字符串参数的长度不相等时，假定使用较短的空格填充较短的字符串（在右侧），以使两个字符串的长度相等。字符串比较是从左到右，在逐个字符的基础上进行的，直到可以为关系测试确定 TRUE / FALSE 值为止。根据字符在程序的 COLLATING SEQUENCE 中的相对位置（如 SPECIAL-NAMES （请参阅SPECIAL-NAMES）中的定义）对字符进行比较，

trans-unit.source: When group items are being defined, subordinate items may be assigned anameofFILLER
trans-unit.target: 当被定义的组的物品，从属项可以被分配一个 name 的 FILLER

trans-unit.source: When group items are being defined, subordinate items may be assigned the “name” FILLER. There may be any number of FILLER items defined within a group item. A data item named FILLER cannot be referenced directly; these items are generally used to specify an unused portion of the total storage allocated to a group item. Note that it is possible that the name of the group item itself might be specified as FILLER if there is no need to ever refer directly to the group structure itself.
trans-unit.target: 在定义组项目时，可以为下属项目分配“名称” FILLER 。一个组项目中可以定义任何数量的 FILLER 项目。不能直接引用名为 FILLER 的数据项。这些项目通常用于指定分配给组项目的总存储中未使用的部分。请注意，如果不需要直接引用组结构本身，则可以将组项目本身的名称指定为 FILLER 。

trans-unit.source: When it first was developed, COBOL’s easily-readable syntax made it profoundly different from anything that had been seen before. For the first time, it was possible to specify logic in a manner that was — at least to some extent — comprehensible even to non-programmers. Take for example, the following code written in FORTRAN — a language developed only a year before COBOL:
trans-unit.target: 最初开发时，COBOL的易于理解的语法使其与以前所见的任何事物都大为不同。首次有可能以至少在某种程度上甚至对非程序员都可以理解的方式来指定逻辑。例如，以下用FORTRAN编写的代码-一种仅在COBOL诞生前一年开发的语言：

trans-unit.source: When multiple programs occur in a source file, it is assumed that the programs are related to one another in that they will be CALLed or executed as functions from the others.
trans-unit.target: 当源文件中出现多个程序时，假定程序彼此相关，因为它们将被 CALL 或作为其他程序的功能执行。

trans-unit.source: When multiple programs occur in a source file, it is assumed that the programs are related to one another in that they will be CALLed or executed as functions from the others.
trans-unit.target: 当在一个源文件中出现多个程序时,假定这些程序是相互关联的,它们将作为其他程序的函数被调用或执行。

trans-unit.source: When only a portion of a reserved word is underlined, it indicates that the word may either be coded in its full form or may be abbreviated to the portion that is underlined.

trans-unit.source: When programs get very large, it becomes more and more challenging to keep track of the data items that will be used in the program. Here, in no particular order of importance, are a variety of conventions that can simply that problem.
trans-unit.target: 当程序变得非常大的时候,要跟踪程序中会用到的数据项就变得越来越有挑战性。在这里,没有特别重要的顺序,是各种惯例,可以简单地解决这个问题。

trans-unit.source: When reading a LINE SEQUENTIAL file, records in excess of the size implied by the file’s description in the FILE SECTION will be truncated while records shorter than that size will be padded to the right with SPACES.
trans-unit.target: 当读取一个 LINE SEQUENTIAL 文件，超过由文件的描述隐含大小的记录 FILE SECTION 将被截去，而比尺寸更短的记录将被补上了合适的 SPACES 。

trans-unit.source: When reading aLINE SEQUENTIALfile, records in excess of the size implied by the file’s description in theFILE SECTIONwill be truncated while records shorter than that size will be padded to the right withSPACES
trans-unit.target: 当读取一个 LINE SEQUENTIAL 文件，超过由文件的描述中隐含的长度记录的 FILE SECTION 将被截去，而比尺寸更短的记录将被补上了合适的 SPACES

trans-unit.source: When reading any sequential (any organization) or relative file, the "next" direction refers to the physical sequence of records in the file. When reading an indexed file, the "next" and "previous" directions refer to the sequence of primary or alternate record key values in the file’s records, regardless of where the records physically occur within the file.
trans-unit.target: 当读取任何顺序的（任何组织）或相对文件时，“下一个”方向是指文件中记录的物理顺序。读取索引文件时，“下一个”和“上一个”方向是指文件记录中主记录或备用记录键值的顺序，无论记录在文件中实际出现在何处。

trans-unit.source: When reading any sequential (any organization) or relative file, the “next” direction refers to the physical sequence of records in the file. When reading an indexed file, the “next” and “previous” directions refer to the sequence of primary or alternate record key values in the file’s records, regardless of where the records physically occur within the file.
trans-unit.target: 当读取任何顺序的（任何组织）或相对文件时，“下一个”方向是指文件中记录的物理顺序。读取索引文件时，“下一个”和“上一个”方向是指文件记录中主记录或备用记录键值的顺序，无论记录在文件中实际出现在何处。

trans-unit.source: When reserved words appear without underlining, as this one is, they are optional; such reserved words are available in the language syntax merely to improve readability — their presence or absence has no effect upon the program.
trans-unit.target: 当保留字没有下划线出现时，这是可选的；这样的保留字仅在语言语法中可用以提高可读性-它们的存在或不存在对程序没有影响。

trans-unit.source: When searching a table with
trans-unit.target: 当搜索一个带有

trans-unit.source: When searching a table with "n" entries, a binary search will need a worst-case of log2(n) tests in order to find an entry and log2(n) tests to identify that an entry doesn’t exist (n = the number of entries in the table), where "log2" is the base-2 logarithm function.
trans-unit.target: 当搜索具有“ n”个条目的表时，二进制搜索将需要最坏情况的log2（n）测试才能找到条目，而log2（n）测试则需要识别不存在的条目（n =表中的条目数），其中“ log2”是以2为底的对数函数。

trans-unit.source: When searching a table with "n" entries, a sequential search will need an average of n/2 tests and a worst case of n tests in order to find an entry and n tests to identify that an entry doesn’t exist.
trans-unit.target: 当搜索具有“ n”个条目的表时，顺序搜索将需要平均n / 2个测试和最坏情况的n个测试才能找到一个条目，并需要n个测试来标识一个条目不存在。

trans-unit.source: When single record locking is in effect, as a new record is accessed, locks held for previous records are released. By using this option, not only is the newly accessed record locked (as WITH LOCK would do), but prior record locks will be retained as well. A subsequent READ without the KEPT LOCK option will release all “kept” locks, as will the UNLOCK statement.
trans-unit.target: 当单记录锁定生效时，随着新记录的访问，为先前记录保留的锁将被释放。通过使用此选项，不仅新访问的记录被锁定（如 WITH LOCK 那样），而且先前的记录锁也将被保留。后续的不带 KEPT LOCK 选项的 READ 将释放所有“保留的”锁， UNLOCK 语句也将释放。

trans-unit.source: When single record locking is in-effect, as a new record is accessed, locks held for previous records are released. By using this option, not only is the newly-accessed record locked (as WITH LOCK would do), but prior record locks will be retained as well. A subsequentREADwithout theKEPT LOCKoption will release all "kept" locks, as will theUNLOCKstatement.
trans-unit.target: 当单个记录锁定生效时，随着访问新记录，将释放为先前记录保留的锁。通过使用此选项，不仅新访问的记录将被锁定（如WITH LOCK那样），而且先前的记录锁定也将被保留。没有 KEPT LOCK 选项的后续 READ 将释放所有“保留的”锁定， UNLOCK 语句也将释放。

trans-unit.source: When specifying FALSE, the value assigned to each parent data item will be the value specified for the FALSE clause of the condition name’s definition; if any condition-name-1 occurrence lacks a FALSE clause, the SET statement will be rejected by the compiler.
trans-unit.target: 当指定 FALSE 时，分配给每个父数据项的值将是为条件名称的定义的 FALSE 子句指定的值；如果任何 condition-name-1 出现缺少 FALSE 子句，则 SET 语句将被编译器拒绝。

trans-unit.source: When specifying TRUE, the value assigned to each parent data item will be the first value specified on the condition name’s VALUE clause.
trans-unit.target: 当指定 TRUE 时，分配给每个父数据项的值将是在条件名称的 VALUE 子句中指定的第一个值。

trans-unit.source: When specifyingFALSE the value assigned to each parent data item will be the value specified for theFALSEclause of the condition name’s definition; if any <

trans-unit.source: When specifyingTRUE the value assigned to each parent data item will be the first value specified on the condition name’sVALUEclause.
trans-unit.target: 如果指定 TRUE ,则分配给每个父数据项的值将是在条件名称的 VALUE 子句中指定的第一个值。

trans-unit.source: When the expression-1 CHARACTERS option is used, INITIALIZED will initialize the allocated memory block to binary zeros. If INITIALIZED is not used, the initial contents of allocated memory will be left to whatever rules of memory allocation are in effect for the operating system the program is running under.
trans-unit.target: 使用 expression-1 CHARACTERS 选项时， INITIALIZED 会将分配的内存块初始化为二进制零。如果不使用 INITIALIZED ，则分配的内存的初始内容将保留给程序在其下运行的操作系统有效的任何内存分配规则。

trans-unit.source: When the ALLOCATE statement (see ALLOCATE) statement is used to allocate a data item or to simply allocate an area of storage of a size specified on the ALLOCATE, that allocation may occur with or without initialization, as per the programmer’s needs.
trans-unit.target: 当将 ALLOCATE 语句（请参阅ALLOCATE）语句用于分配数据项或仅分配在 ALLOCATE 上指定的大小的存储区域时，根据程序员的需要，可以在初始化时或不初始化时进行该分配。

trans-unit.source: When the ENTRY statement (see ENTRY) is being used.
trans-unit.target: 使用 ENTRY 语句（请参阅ENTRY）时。

trans-unit.source: When the Enter key is pressed.
trans-unit.target: 当按下 Enter 键时。

trans-unit.source: When the LOCALE keyword is not specified, the returning value is negative if string contains CR, DB, or a minus sign.
trans-unit.target: 当 LOCALE 不指定关键字，返回值是负数，如果字符串包含CR，DB，或减号。

trans-unit.source: When the LOCALE keyword is specified, the returned value is negative if string contains a negative sign and when not specified, the returning value is negative if string contains CR, DB, or a minus sign.
trans-unit.target: 当指定 LOCALE 关键字时，如果字符串包含负号，则返回值为负；如果未指定，则如果字符串包含CR，DB或负号，则返回值为负。

trans-unit.source: When the LOCALE keyword is specified, the returned value is negative if string contains a negative sign.
trans-unit.target: 当 LOCALE 指定关键字，返回的值是负的，如果字符串包含一个负号。

trans-unit.source: When the PERFORM begins execution, the FROM value will be moved to identifier.
trans-unit.target: 当 PERFORM 开始执行时， FROM 值将移动到 identifier 。

trans-unit.source: When the identifier-1 option is used in conjunction with INITIALIZED (or its internationalized alternative INITIALISED), the allocated memory block will be initialized as if an INITIALIZE identifier-1 WITH FILLER ALL TO VALUE THEN TO DEFAULT (see INITIALIZE) were executed.
trans-unit.target: 当将 identifier-1 选项与 INITIALIZED （或其国际化的替代 INITIALISED ）结合使用时，将初始化已分配的内存块，就像执行了将 INITIALIZE identifier-1 WITH FILLER ALL TO VALUE THEN TO DEFAULT 的INITIALIZE identifier-1 （请参见INITIALIZE）一样。

trans-unit.source: When the character set in use is ASCII with no collating sequence modifications, the LOW-VALUES figurative constant value is the ASCII NUL character. Because character sets can be redefined, however, you should not rely on this fact. Use the NULL figurative constant instead.
trans-unit.target: 当使用的字符集是ASCII且没有排序顺序修改时， LOW-VALUES 图形常量值是ASCII NUL 字符。但是，由于可以重新定义字符集，因此您不应依赖此事实。请改用 NULL 图形常量。

trans-unit.source: When the character set in use is ASCII with no collating sequence modifications, theLOW-VALUESfigurative constant value is the ASCII "NUL" character. Because character sets can be redefined, however, you should not rely on this fact — use theNULLfigurative constant instead.
trans-unit.target: 当使用的字符集是ASCII且没有排序顺序修改时， LOW-VALUES 图形常量是ASCII“ NUL”字符。但是，由于可以重新定义字符集，因此您不应该依赖这个事实，而应使用 NULL 图形常量。

trans-unit.source: When the compiler is operating in Fixed Format Mode, all CDF statements must begin in column eight (8) or beyond.
trans-unit.target: 当编译器在固定格式模式下运行时,所有的CDF语句必须从第8列(8)或以后开始。

trans-unit.source: When the console is running in a windowed environment, this will be the sizing of the window in which the program is executing, in terms of horizontal (COLUMNS) or vertical (LINES) character counts — not pixels.
trans-unit.target: 当控制台在窗口环境中运行时，这将是程序在其中执行的窗口的大小，以水平（ COLUMNS ）或垂直（ LINES ）字符数（而不是像素）为单位。

trans-unit.source: When the console is running in a windowed environment, this will be the sizing of the window in which the program is executing, in terms of horizontal COLUMNS or vertical LINES character counts — not pixels.
trans-unit.target: 当控制台在窗口环境中运行，这将是其在程序执行窗口的大小，在水平方面 COLUMNS 或垂直 LINES 字符计数-而不是像素。

trans-unit.source: When the end of the currently-compiling source file is reached, Replace Mode is deactivated and any stacked replace specifications will be discarded — compilation of the next source file (if any) will begin with Replace Mode inactive and no change specification(s) on the stack.
trans-unit.target: 当到达当前正在编译的源文件的末尾时，替换模式将被停用，所有堆叠的替换规范都将被丢弃-下一个源文件（如果有）的编译将以“替换模式”处于非活动状态开始，并且没有更改规范堆栈。

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the GnuCOBOL runtime system will strip the trailing delimiter sequence from each record. The data will be padded (on the right) with spaces if the data just read is shorter than the area described for data records in the program. If the data is too long, it will be truncated and the excess will be lost.
trans-unit.target: 读取文件时,GnuCOBOL运行时系统将从每条记录中剥离尾部定界符序列。如果刚刚读取的数据比程序中数据记录所描述的区域短,那么数据将用空格来填充(在右边)。如果数据太长,则会被截断,多余的数据将丢失。

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the data is transferred into the program exactly as it exists in the file.
trans-unit.target: 读取文件时,数据会完全按照文件中存在的数据传输到程序中。

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the data is transferred into the program exactly as it exists in the file. In the event that a short record is read as the very last record, that record will be padded (to the right) with spaces.
trans-unit.target: 当文件被读取时,数据被完全按照文件中的内容传输到程序中。如果一条短记录作为最后一条记录被读取,该记录将用空格填充(向右)。

trans-unit.source: When the file is written by a GnuCOBOL program, no delimiter sequence is appended to the data, but a record-length field is added to the beginning of each physical record.
trans-unit.target: 当文件由GnuCOBOL程序写入时,数据中不附加任何定界符序列,但每个物理记录的开头都会添加一个记录长度字段。

trans-unit.source: When the file is written to by a GnuCOBOL program, the delimiter sequence will be automatically appended to each data record as it is written to the file. A WRITE (see WRITE) to this type of file will be done as if a BEFORE ADVANCING 1 LINE clause were specified on the WRITE, if no ADVANCING clause is coded.
trans-unit.target: 当文件由GnuCOBOL程序写入时，定界符序列将在写入到文件时自动附加到每个数据记录。如果未对 ADVANCING 子句进行编码，则将执行对此类文件的 WRITE （请参阅WRITE），就像在 WRITE 上指定了 BEFORE ADVANCING 1 LINE 子句一样。

trans-unit.source: When the file is written to by a GnuCOBOL program, the delimiter sequence will be automatically appended to each data record as it is written to the file. AWRITE(see WRITE) to this type of file will be done as if aBEFORE ADVANCING 1 LINEclause were specified on theWRITE if noADVANCINGclause is coded.
trans-unit.target: 当文件由GnuCOBOL程序写入时，定界符序列将在写入到文件时自动附加到每个数据记录。如果未编码 ADVANCING 子句，则将执行对此类文件的 WRITE （请参阅WRITE），就好像在 WRITE 上指定了 BEFORE ADVANCING 1 LINE 子句一样。

trans-unit.source: When the first GENERATE statement for a report is executed, the contents of all control fields are saved so they may be referenced during the processing of subsequent GENERATE statements.
trans-unit.target: 当执行报表的第一个 GENERATE 语句时，将保存所有控制字段的内容，以便在后续 GENERATE 语句的处理过程中可以引用它们。

trans-unit.source: When the system is not running a windowing environment, the physical console screen attributes will be returned.

trans-unit.source: When the system is running in a windowed environment, this will be the sizing of the console window in which the program is executing. When the system is not running a windowing environment, the physical console screen attributes will be returned. In environments such as a Windows console window, where the logical size of the window may far exceed that of the physical console window, the size returned will be that of the physical console window. Two one-byte values will be returned — the first will be the current number of lines (rows) while the second will be the number of columns.
trans-unit.target: 当系统在窗口环境中运行时，这将是执行程序的控制台窗口的大小。当系统未运行窗口环境时，将返回物理控制台屏幕属性。在Windows控制台窗口等环境中，该窗口的逻辑大小可能远远超过物理控制台窗口的逻辑大小，返回的大小将是物理控制台窗口的大小。将返回两个一个字节的值-第一个将是当前行数（行），而第二个将是列数。

trans-unit.source: When you write GnuCOBOL programs, you’ll need to create a variety of words to represent various aspects of the program, the program’s data and the external environment in which the program will run. This will include internal names by which data files will be referenced, data item names and names of executable logic procedures.

trans-unit.source: When your program opens a file with this sharing option in effect, no restrictions will be placed on other programs attempting toOPENthe file after your program did. This is the default sharing mode.

trans-unit.source: When your program opens a file with this sharing option in effect, your program announces that it is unwilling to allow any other program to have any access to the file as long as you are using that file; OPEN attempts made in other programs will fail with a file status of 37 (PERMISSION DENIED) until such time as you CLOSE (see CLOSE) the file.
trans-unit.target: 当您的程序打开一个具有该共享选项的文件时，您的程序便宣布不愿意任何其他程序访问该文件，只要您正在使用该文件即可。在其他程序中进行的 OPEN 尝试将以文件状态37（ PERMISSION DENIED ）失败，直到 CLOSE （请参阅CLOSE）该文件。

trans-unit.source: While GnuCOBOL supports few of the OOP programming constructs defined by the COBOL2002 and COBOL2014 standards, it supports every aspect of the ANSI 85 standard and therefore fully meets the needs of points #1 and #2, above. With its supported feature set (see So What is GnuCOBOL?), it provides significant programmer productivity capabilities.
trans-unit.target: 尽管GnuCOBOL支持由COBOL2002和COBOL2014标准定义的少数OOP编程结构，但它支持ANSI 85标准的各个方面，因此完全满足上述第1点和第2点的需求。凭借其受支持的功能集（请参阅GnuCOBOL是什么？），它提供了重要的程序员生产力功能。

trans-unit.source: While GnuCOBOL supports few of the OOP programming constructs defined by the COBOL2002 and COBOL20xx standards, it supports every aspect of the ANSI 85 standard and therefore fully meets the needs of points #1 and #2, above. With it’s supported feature set (see So What is GnuCOBOL?), it provides significant programmer productivity capabilities.
trans-unit.target: 尽管GnuCOBOL支持由COBOL2002和COBOL20xx标准定义的几种OOP编程结构，但它支持ANSI 85标准的各个方面，因此完全满足上述第1点和第2点的需求。凭借其受支持的功能集（请参阅GnuCOBOL是什么？），它提供了重要的程序员生产力功能。

trans-unit.source: While an ORGANIZATION RELATIVE file may be defined as having variable-length records, the file will be structured in such a manner as to reserve space for each record equal to the size of the largest possible record as defined by the file’s description in the FILE SECTION.

trans-unit.source: While any COBOL implementation’s sort or merge facilities guarantee that records with duplicate key values will be in proper sequence with regard to other records with different key values, they generally make no promises as to the resulting relative sequence of records having duplicate key values with one another.

trans-unit.source: Windows implementations of GnuCOBOL may, or may not, be similarly case sensitive with regard to copybook names, depending upon the Windows version and GnuCOBOL build options — it is safest to simply treat the COPY command as case-sensitive in all environments.

trans-unit.source: With a binary search, express the number of entries as a binary number (1,000 = 1111101000), count the number of digits in the result (which is, essentially, what a logarithm is, when rounded up to the next integer — the number of digits a decimal number would have if expressed in the logarithm’s number base). In this case, we end up with 10 —
trans-unit.target: 使用二进制搜索时，将条目数表示为二进制数（1,000 = 1111101000），计算结果中的位数（从本质上讲，是对数值是四舍五入到下一个整数时的对数）。如果以对数的数字底数表示，则十进制数字将具有十进制数字）。在这种情况下，我们最终得到10-

trans-unit.source: With a binary search, express the number of entries as a binary number (1,000 = 1111101000), count the number of digits in the result (which is, essentially, what a logarithm is, when rounded up to the next integer — the number of digits a decimal number would have if expressed in the logarithm’s number base). In this case, we end up with 10 — THAT is the worst-case number of tests required to find an entry or to identify that it doesn’t exist. That’s quite an improvement!
trans-unit.target: 使用二进制搜索时，将条目数表示为二进制数（1,000 = 1111101000），计算结果中的位数（从本质上讲，它是对数值，四舍五入到下一个整数时，即-如果以对数的数字基数表示，则十进制数字将具有十进制数字）。在这种情况下，我们最终得到10个-这是找到条目或识别条目不存在所需的最坏情况的测试数。这是一个很大的进步！

trans-unit.source: With its original limitation on the length of variable names (one- to six-character names comprised of a letter followed by up to five letters and/or digits), it’s implicit rule that variable were automatically created as real (floating-point) unless their name started with a letter in the range I-N, and its use of algebraic notation to express actions being taken, FORTRAN wasn’t a particularly readable language, even for programmers. Compare this with the equivalent COBOL code:
trans-unit.target: 由于其最初对变量名长度的限制（一到六个字符的名称，由一个字母和最多五个字母和/或数字组成），隐含的规则是，除非将变量自动创建为实数（浮点数），否则它们的名称以IN范围内的字母开头，并且使用代数符号表示所采取的动作，即使对于程序员而言，FORTRAN也不是一种特别易读的语言。将此与等效的COBOL代码进行比较：

Any COBOL 85 compiler would have allowed the following solution to our problem:

trans-unit.source: With this form My-01-Item can either be defined with the BASED attribute or be defined in LINKAGE SECTION. Instead of LENGTH OF My-01-Item you may also use a size smaller to the maximum field size as long as you ensure that the complete field is never used.

trans-unit.source: With this form, a block of storage equal in size to the defined size of My-01-Item (which must have been defined with the BASED attribute) will be allocated. The address of that block of storage will become the base address of My-01-Item so that it and its subordinate data items become usable within the program.
trans-unit.target: 通过这种形式，将分配一个存储块，其大小等于My-01-Item的定义大小（必须已使用 BASED 属性定义）。该存储块的地址将成为My-01-Item的基址，以便它及其从属数据项在程序中可用。

trans-unit.source: With this option, the program will wait for a pre-configured time for the lock to be released. If the lock is released within the preconfigured wait time, the read will be successful. If the pre-configured wait time expires before the lock is released, the read attempt will be aborted and a 51 file status will be issued.
trans-unit.target: 使用该选项,程序将等待一个预先配置的时间来释放锁。如果锁在预设的等待时间内被释放,读取将成功。如果预设的等待时间在锁被释放前已过,则读取尝试将被中止,并发出51文件状态。

trans-unit.source: With this option, the program will wait for a preconfigured time for the lock to be released. If the lock is released within the preconfigured wait time, the read will be successful. If the preconfigured wait time expires before the lock is released, the read attempt will be aborted and a 51 file status will be issued.
trans-unit.target: 使用该选项,程序将等待一个预先配置的时间来释放锁。如果锁在预设的等待时间内被释放,读取将成功。如果预设的等待时间在锁释放前已过,则读取尝试将被中止,并发出51文件状态。

trans-unit.source: You can force the GnuCOBOL runtime system to pre-load all dynamically-loaded modules that could ever be called by the program, at the time the program starts executing. This is accomplished through the use of the COB_PRE_LOAD run-time environment variable (see Run Time Environment Variables). If used, this will only pre-load those modules invoked via CALL literal-1, as the runtime contents of identifier-1 cannot be predicted.
trans-unit.target: 您可以强制GnuCOBOL运行时系统在程序开始执行时预加载该程序可能曾经调用过的所有动态加载的模块。这可以通过使用 COB_PRE_LOAD 运行时环境变量来完成（请参见运行时环境变量）。如果使用，这将仅预加载通过 CALL literal-1 调用的那些模块，因为无法预测 identifier-1 的运行时内容。

trans-unit.source: You may only write new content (which will be appended after the previously existing file contents) to the file — only the CLOSE, UNLOCK and WRITE statements will be allowed. trans-unit.source: allows a custom defined calling convention to be used. Such mnemonic names are defined using the CALL-CONVENTION (see SPECIAL-NAMES) clause. That clause associates a decimal integer value with mnemonic-name-1 such that the individual bits set on or off in the binary equivalent of the integer affect linkage to the subroutine as described in the following chart. Those rows of the chart marked with a “No” in the Supported column represent bit positions (switch settings) in the integer value that are currently accepted (to provide compatibility to other COBOL implementations) if coded, but are otherwise unsupported.
trans-unit.target: 允许使用自定义定义的调用约定。此类助记符名称是使用 CALL-CONVENTION （请参阅SPECIAL-NAMES）子句定义的。该子句将十进制整数值与 mnemonic-name-1 相关联，以使得在整数的二进制等效项中打开或关闭的各个位会影响到子例程的链接，如下图所示。图表中那些在“支持的”列中标记为“否”的行表示整数值中的位位置（开关设置），如果已编码，则当前可以接受这些位（以提供与其他COBOL实现的兼容性），但其他方式不受支持。

trans-unit.source: allows system standard calling conventions (as opposed to GnuCOBOL calling conventions) to be used when calling a subroutine. The definition of what constitutes “system standard” may vary from operating system to operating system. Use of this requires special knowledge about the linkage requirements of subroutines you are intending to CALL. Subroutines written in GnuCOBOL do not need this option.
trans-unit.target: 允许在调用子例程时使用系统标准的调用约定（与GnuCOBOL调用约定相反）。构成“系统标准”的定义可能因操作系统而异。使用此功能需要有关您要 CALL 的子例程的链接要求的特殊知识。用GnuCOBOL编写的子例程不需要此选项。

trans-unit.source: being passed as an argument. The item may anything defined within the data division of the program. If the subroutine modifies the contents of this argument, the calling program will “see” the results of that change when the subroutine returns control. trans-unit.source: difficult, however, is coming up with a scheme for per-statement mark up of changes that doesn’t introduce a ridiculously excessive number of source lines to the program. I’m not sure there is a good answer to this problem (if a reader has one, please let me know). Generally, I’ve noticed that shops using free-format conventions for their COBOL source tend to stick with just the top-of-program comment block combined with minimal comment blocks sprinkled throughout the program noting areas that underwent major changes.
trans-unit.target: 但是，很难提出一种针对每个语句标记更改的方案，而该方案不会给程序带来过多的源代码行。我不确定这个问题是否有好的答案（如果读者有一个答案，请告诉我）。通常，我已经注意到，使用自由格式约定作为COBOL源的商店倾向于坚持只使用程序顶部的注释框，并在整个程序中散布最少的注释框，注意进行了重大更改的区域。

trans-unit.source: format, respectively. The former allows for up to 16 digits of exact precision while the latter offers 34. The phrase “exact precision” is used because the traditional binary renderings of decimal real numbers in a floating-point format (FLOAT-LONG and FLOAT-SHORT, for example) only yield an approximation of the actual value because many decimal fractions cannot be precisely rendered in binary. The Decimal64 and Decimal128 renderings, however, render decimal real numbers in encoded decimal form in much the same way that PACKED-DECIMAL renders a decimal integer in digit-by-digit decimal form. The exact manner in which this rendering is performed is complex (Wikipedia has an excellent article on the subject — just search for
trans-unit.target: 格式。前者允许多达16位的精确精度，而后者则提供34位精度。之所以使用短语“精确精度”，是因为传统的二进制实数二进制十进制实数采用浮点格式（ FLOAT-LONG 和 FLOAT-SHORT ，用于例）仅产生实际值的近似值，因为许多十进制小数不能精确地用二进制表示。但是，Decimal64和Decimal128呈现以编码的十进制形式呈现十进制实数，其方式与 PACKED-DECIMAL 呈数字一位十进制形式呈现十进制整数的方式几乎相同。进行渲染的确切方式很复杂（Wikipedia在该主题上有出色的文章-只需搜索

trans-unit.source: formats, respectively. These are binary encodings of real decimal numbers, and as such cannot represent every possible value between the minimum and maximum values in the range for those usages. Wikipedia has an excellent article on the Binary64 and Binary32 encoding schemes — just search on
trans-unit.target: 格式。这些是实数十进制数字的二进制编码，因此不能表示这些用途范围内最小值和最大值之间的所有可能值。Wikipedia上有一篇关于Binary64和Binary32编码方案的出色文章-只需搜索

trans-unit.source: of a COBOL statement (columns 1-6) has come to be used as a change indicator area. Programmers would place a code in columns 1-6 of every line they changed in a program. The author works in a COBOL shop where change indicators of the form “xxmmyy” are required on every altered line of a program — “xx” is the initials of the programmer while “mmyy” are the month and two-digit year of the date the change was made. This is frequently accompanied by a comment block at or near the top of a COBOL program providing general documentation of what changes were made and what change indicator was used to mark that change.
trans-unit.target: COBOL语句（第1-6列）的“注释”已用作更改指示符区域。程序员将在他们在程序中更改的每一行的1-6列中放置一个代码。作者在COBOL商店工作，在程序的每条更改的行上都需要“ xxmmyy”形式的更改指示符-“ xx”是程序员的姓名缩写，而“ mmyy”是日期的月份和两位数字进行了更改。这通常在COBOL程序顶部或附近带有注释框，该注释框提供有关进行了哪些更改以及使用哪些更改指示符来标记该更改的常规文档。
